intro: Echinocarpus macbrydei, commonly known as the hairy burr sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spiny, hairy fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with hairy surfaces, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. The botanical features of Echinocarpus macbrydei make it adaptable to various soil types and climatic conditions.
